subject: Added APIs to support multiseat in wayland
commitMessage:
Added APIs to support multiseat in wayland

Clients can use name and/or seatname of the outputs
to select the output(s) as per its need

Change-Id: I92377f262a19371a747ce1cdeddcb790171e51c1
Signed-off-by: Imran Zaman <imran.zaman@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

Globally, this is good. Most of the changes done build conditionally, and some of the source code ones are actually bug fixes which have been submitted upstream : so, these can be accepted as-is.

The difficult source code changes are the ones about WAYLAND_CLIENT_DIR and WAYLAND_SERVER_DIR environment variables. Mutliseat config uses them to "negociate" a socket path between users. As Common already uses specific systemd services (display-manager.service) with "ln - chmod - chown" commands for this purpose, I'd like to make them conditional, too.

What do you think about :

http://www.tarnyko.net/repo/wayland-multiseat_imran.patch

on top of your own patch ?
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

Looks good to me !
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

The tag submit/accepted/tizen/20131204.185210/20140213.124919 was pushed, but it was not completed because of the following reason(s):

- The tag means you want to submit commit 885b6bf3c768a4e1a358bc695b9cb111256d6c1d in accepted/tizen/20131204.185210 branch to OBS, but this commit does NOT exist in accepted/tizen/20131204.185210 branch. Please use correct branch name as version in tag name submit/{version}/{date.time}.

Suggest to use "gbs submit" to trigger submission, or use following command to create tag "git tag submit/${version}/$(date --utc +%%Y%%m%%d.%%H%%M%%S) -m "****" ".

Patch Set 1:

The tag submit/tizen/20140213.130048 was pushed, but it was not completed because of the following reason(s):

- The tag means you want to submit commit 885b6bf3c768a4e1a358bc695b9cb111256d6c1d in tizen branch to OBS, but this commit does NOT exist in tizen branch. Please use correct branch name as version in tag name submit/{version}/{date.time}.

Suggest to use "gbs submit" to trigger submission, or use following command to create tag "git tag submit/${version}/$(date --utc +%%Y%%m%%d.%%H%%M%%S) -m "****" ".
